number of helpful: 23 of 28 people (82%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								Here’s the thing. I paid full game money and got a pre-Alpha build. I expect more from Atari. This is why you see everyone everywhere saying not to pre-order games. Reminds me of when the new Sim City launched, now Maxis is dead. I get that we’re on the 3rd dev now but this is insane.Don’t buy this game. It is not worth $50.First off the graphics are sub-par, at best, and even on low settings the frame rate is awful. There are terrible issues with building scale, little food stands being as big as full rides for starters. There is barely enough content to make a themed section of a park.I basically used up all the rides in 2 zones. You get 9 zones. WTF am I supposed to do with the rest of the zones? Make my own coaster with 20 FPS and a terrible coaster builder? The coaster builder sucks. It is not intuitive. It doesn’t let you add special tracks easily; you can’t make the kind of coasters you want. I was trying to make a simple Six Flags Superman style ride. Can’t do it. RCT3 could do it. How does a full version of the game not have at the very bare minimum what the last version had? RCT3 came out in ’04 and you want me to believe you can’t have all that stuff added into a new game in ’16?!?! If they had just taken RCT3 and put it into a new engine so it looked better and ran smoother, I’d be more happy than I am with wasting the money I did on this garbage.Pathing is awful. There is a lot of really weird snapping and even using the grid it’s hard to make straight lines. Curved paths almost seem easier which doesn’t make sense.The delete tool is garbage, and… oh what’s that you want to play one of the scenarios? Cool. Have fun trying to place rides anywhere. If there are trees or tiny little bushes you can’t plop stuff down, you first have to use the god-awful delete or move tools to get rid of the plants. One by freaking one. You would think you could just right click and the game would know you want to delete that stupid bush but apparently that’s too much to ask for.The list goes on and on. You can’t get your staff to do what you’re paying them to do. There is literally no guidance for how to please people or how to keep them from puking after every damn ride. Even the giant slide. The economy is dumb.Don’t buy this game. Odds are Atari is going to pull the plug on it rather than give it dev time it needs. You would literally be better off taking $50 and and burning it for the few moments of heat it provided you.

number of helpful: 60 of 93 people (65%) found this review helpful8 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 25, 2016
Early Access Review
								It has been some time since the release of RCTW Early Access and I feel the game has reached a level where a review is warranted. There have been many negative reviews, and I can see the frustrations that led many to leave such, but a lot of those seem to have dismissed the game after a few moments of play. Not giving the game a chance to show off its potential.And in Early Access, potential is what we want to consider, The foundation that RCTW has laid is such that it may very well grow into that potentail we can glimpse. Should UGC become full, and each day we see more pieces added, should Piece by Piece building with the UGC be solved, and each update we see that happening. Then the foundation could lead to overwhelming success.At present, for those who are creative, the park builders, I would say the game has enough that you can find many hours of contentment playing it. For those who are problem solvers and want to play scenarios, we are not quite there yet with needing AI to balance better, with the scenarios to be tweaked better. But for the $50 price, it is closer each to day to be the successor to RCT3. At present the trajectory that it is on, may never get us to being equal or better than RCT3. But perhaps one rung below it. Though should more coaster types, more rides, more more more be released, then it might even surpass RCT3 for at present the graphics are better. Should the gameplay expand, UGC be optimized and the others items that we can see the potential to better happen, then yes, we shall have a GAME!

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
Early Access Review
								In its current state RCTW is a complete flop - there I've said it. I am keeping in mind that this is an alpha, however; it is stil just as dissapointing to me. When you look at Roller Coaster Tycoon you recognize a franchise that is well known for being composed of quality games. Well I'm sad to say that after RCT4 - Mobile and the Alpha of RCTW that this may now be a false statement. As a lifelong fan of this game (I've been playing it since the original and since I was old enough to understand how to play video games) I am remaining cautiously optimistic about the future of this game, I see its potential and the ability of the community to greatly improve each other's experiences through the vast network of custom scenery objects now available on the Steam Workshop.In its current state I'd rate the game no higher than a 5/10 and here's why:- The coaster builder is VERY clunky, occasionally it becomes impossible to continue building as you need to use the presets to place a piece before you can freeform it. This causes issues when your piece wants to dive underground, yet you wish to freeform it and keep it above ground.- Staff buildings, now some will say this really isn't an issue (and I agree to an extent) however, by making staff members simply components of the building we place we lose our abilities to both customize them and set specific routes for them, two things that were nice about RCTW's predecessors. I do like the idea of the staff buildings and it adds a little more realism, however; for it to work for me the same level of customizability present in its predecessors must also be available.- FPS drops, now I have a top of the line computer (one capable of running Fallout 4 on near maximum graphics settings) so running RCTW shouldn't be a problem for my computer AT ALL. Unfortunately the reality is that I'm plagued by random FPS drops and "input lag" at least 70% of the time I spend on this game. The worst part is that it happens in almost entirely empty parks - Atari you really need to work on this.- Lack of flat rides, I understand that this is an Early Release (alpha if you will) however it would be nice to have some more generic flat rides that aren't soo heavily themed. Perhaps an option to toggle what the ride's theme is? I'm not sure if anything will be done about this but if you're going for one specific theme your options are quite limited.- Scenery placement, all of the previous games had this issue as well. Planet Coaster is the only one I've seen that has done this right soo far. I'd love to see scenery that we can place anywhere so that we can properly theme rides/areas. What is the point of having a giant tree with a hole that looks as though you could run something through it if you can't put anything through it?- Lastly I'd like to say that I feel this game should be MUCH farther along than it currently is. No I do not know anything about video game developement and yes I know there were three developers working on this game. Nvizzio, if you're reading this please take what I've said and will continue to say as constructive criticism. I love the RCT series and I want to see this become a AAA title, but right now I see a game that is waiting to die upon release. RCTW was originally announced to release in Early 2015, it is now Early 2016, and we only have an Early Access. Slow and steady wins the race and making a quality project is 100% always better than rushing out unfinished garbage, however; I feel a year of delays for this game is enough. Nvizzio, Atari, this is crunch time. The community will not continue to stand for delays, you're already losing your fanbase to Planet Coaster. I'm not saying rush a finished project, I'm saying make sure you do this right in a timely fashion. The fan uproar that you see now and the fanbase's lack of faith in you is only the beginning if you really mess this one up.To conclude I would not recommend this game to anyone, not until some serious work is done. I will continue to mess around with it but I really doubt I will play this anywhere close to as much as I played the past three. If you want your money's worth now I'd buy Planet Coaster or Parkitect. Although honestly who knows, I have faith in the team at Nvizzio that they truely want to deliver a AAA title for us fans and I'm willing to ride the storm out and see where they take us.

												In short... A dissapointing let down and waste of money.I bought this game knowing that it was early access, but liked their vision for the game, enjoyed their previous RCT games and wanted to support them. I installed the game, played it for a little while and decided that it wasnt at a good enough stage yet, but left it like that, 3 months later, i did the same again... 4/5 times later i could see lots of room for improvement, especially alongside Planet Coaster.Then it happened... Planet coaster was coming close to it's release date, and the RCT:W devs had a panic... they'd spent so much time and money developing yet another game was coming that did it better. They had a decision to make, should they take their time, learn from others and fix their game? or should they do everything they can to rush an unfinished product to market in a bid to steal peoples money? Yep, you guessed it! they announced a release date a week prior to that of Planet coaster, and charged slightly less for the game.Having had the game in my library for so long with 8 hours played, im not entitled to a refund... Leaving me rather annoyed that my money has been stolen and my good will has been taken advantage of.I should have seen it coming really, they pretty much pulled the same move with TDU2. (Hype it up, release utter drivel, not give a crap)The only plus side is that they are trying to continue on with this title, so it could suddenly become a great game... and i could win the lottery.

number of helpful: 29 of 41 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								As so many of my fellow millenials, I grew up with RCT in the late 90's and early 2000's. It is a great franchise and still loads of fun. All of you may know that the fourth installation in the series was avidly awaited by many a fan. After a troublesome development history, yesterday the game came out in early access. It is facing stiff competition from Planet Coaster and Parkitecht, so comparisons between the two are inevitable. Nevertheless, in the promo-video's, dev-diaries, etc, the devs vowed to come with something worthwhile.So what came of it? To put it bluntly: An unfinished, unpolished alpha-build that is rife with bugs. The potential is there, especially in the coaster builder, but the detail, the path-tool, the management-aspect, the graphics  and the camera-handling are far below par. It is essential that this is going to be adressed in the near future. The communication by the devs towards the coaster-community is in this regard not very encouraging. I think it is only fair that the devs have to come with an open and honest statement about the development stage and a feasible time schedule which lays out at what times what issues will be fixed and what kind of content will be added. RCT world has potential. If they get the coaster tool working in a proper way, it even has the potential to outshine Planet coaster in at least one regard. But so far, this product is not ready for sale and an embarrasment for the franchise. Let's hope that the devs will quickly do what needs to be done. Come clean to the fanbase and coaster community. Only then can they regain some credibility....

content:

Early Access Review
								I have played all of the RCT Series, I enjoyed them all but I like RCT 1 our of the lot the best.RCTW for me is quite a disappointment from a technical stand point.Firstly the graphics are weak, Let down by poor quality textures, The world feels like it has no charm as the world lighting appears washed out.Building experience is more prefabricated than the original, You can't choose where to place entrances and exits but at least you can free rotate to any angle.Building paths is clunky and has annoying link snap points, its not true free form construction. I have not found it possible to place shops how I want at path edges and construct a plaza style area, they have to have short paths leading to them.While you can do curved paths, You annoyingly can't do curved queue's????...The coaster spline tool is quite good, However the tools feeding back Intensity, Nausea and Excitement data are very frustrating to work with. You have to open the ride and let it run to get the info, then close it again and make your adjustments rather than being able to get the data from a test run...Overall there a quite a few minor annoyances with this game that are just about enough to ruin the experience.

content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is the first review I have ever written. I am writing this while my refund is pending. RCTW has great potential to be an amazing game. After playing for a few hours and watching streams and such for a few hours, I can not recommend this game in it's current form. I have hope that the developer will turn this around. After watching the latest stream they did, i can see why RCTW is not a success. They have forgotten what it is about. They have forgotten what makes the RCT series great. They have forgotten it is about the roller coasters! After seeing some of the pre-built roller coasters that are available, I wonder if any of them have ever rode one. There were a few things that made me consider opting for the refund, and one thing in particular that lauched me out of the station. First, i tried to build a pretty common element on looping steel rollercoasters called a cobra roll. It is impossible. Well... i cant say impossible. If i wanted to spend hours trying to get it to work i probably could have made it work, but lets get real. Who wants to spend that amount of time on one element. Since the beginning of RCT time, you were able to build  a half loop into a left or right half corkscrew, then into the opposing corkscrew piece, and finally finish of with you second half loop. Now when i tried with the current iteration in the series, i did my half loop, then into a half cor... nope... no half corkscrew piece. Instead there were multiple corkscrews, and not even in the right direction. It was going up into the air, opposite direction and behind the half loop. Now you can do alot with RCTW's spline based coaster builder, but that was just rediculous. I ended up just doing a large loop and making a few other spaced out elements before returning the track to the station. The coaster ended up being well recieved by my parks patrons, but I was about to call my doctor to schedule chemo. So a couple of days later I had an idea. Im going to try to build one of my favorite roller coasters, Kennywood's Thunderbolt. How i have built recreations in the past, especially Kennywood coasters, is to build them on flat ground then save the blueprint. Then, dig a  hole in the ground since all of their coasters are hugging ravines. So as I finished and tested Thunderbolt-ish, i was getting excited to save and put my coaster in its final resting place. Instead i think i may have found RCTW's final resting place. When i was trying to lower i found that you simply cannot do that.it would not even go down till the bottom most piece of track was touching the ground. What the $@*&?!?! I was dumbfounded. I had no solution. Since i was already frustrated from trying to make the rollercoaster in the first place and just wanted to be done, i decided to just raise the terrain and say the heck with it. Cant do that either... all of the land where there were only supports would not level out with the rest. So i had holes in the ground everywhere there were supports. The list of obsenities that proceded from my mouth were many. So that was pretty much strike two. So a couple days later, I read that they are launching the game. I also read that there would be a live stream. I missed the live part, but did watch it a few days later. Nothing new. Same crap different version. They showed off that the peeps aren't skating across the ground anymore, the new "campaign mode", and more PxP. What the heck is PxP? Oh, that is the scenery. I swear if i hear them say peice by peice one more time imma kms. Like this is ROLLERCOASTER Tycoon... not Scenery Tycoon. So much emphasis has been placed on scenery while the fuctionality of simple things like rollercoasters and paths are put on the back burner. While watching the stream, seeing that woman force Daisy out, I said to myself, "Yup... I'm done."

content:
Posted: April 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								Let me start off by saying.. If you want to play the TRUE sequel of RCT3, buy Planet Coaster (Early Bird Alpha Edition). This is just ANOTHER "Park Construction and Management Sim" that got called RCTW. I'm not going to point out the reasons, if you don't believe me, patch your eye for 2 hours and try both games.Straight to the point..The Track Editor works well, with less than 5 minutes toying around you will be able to create smooth, visualy fluid and funny rides.No Transport Rides, no Mini Golf.. among others.There are some restrictions while placing scenary objects that sometimes can be a bit anoying.It is possible to make curved paths, to do them visualy pleasant is not that easy.Terraforming works like a charm.Textures are not impresive for a 2016 game.Peeps are not same we used to see in RCT3 which is the most iconic part of the game.As expected in Early Access, you will get some lag, random freeze.There is a lot of work to be done and i hope the game improves over time but for now is not possible to enjoy it.My advice: If you are a diehard RCT fan, please do you a favor and get Planet Coaster. If you just like Park Sims in general, you can also buy this one.. and cheaper than 50$.                    -------------------- EDIT 04/09/2016 ---------------------I'm going to follow the changes coming to the game until it's officially released, I'll change my review based on the final product.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2016
												Do not waste your money..I was the first on the band wagon. The frist day it was available I purchased this game over 8 month before the pre release....i kept following waiting for the game to be released as optimistic as possilble. I absolutely love the other RCT games 1,2 & yes even 3. But this game is a total disaster. It takes way to much effort to build anything in this game. The previous games were set up for you to build, manage, and watch your park grow. If you want build something here is the scenario...First you find where you want to position your item holding shift and scrolline your mouse to rotate the item (very time consuming)...then back out and go to destruction mode and delete trees....if the trees are in a field then you can use the mass delete. But if they are close to a path you must individaully click on each item(I scream everytime). Then go back to the buidling menu find your item again....reposition it where is was originally place the item. Then go to build a path....because its not grid based building paths are an extreme pain (not exagerating). I really want to know the thought process given to changing the way paths are built, it is because of this that I have hated this game from day 1.... It is just way to challenging to waste buildin paths. I did not purchase a $60 game to struggle with building sidewalks all day and yet that what I have done in this game.Next major issue is moving around in the game you must use w,q,e,s,d,z,x, to move in the game. or take you hand off the mouse and use the keyboard arrows. in order to change your angle holding control and moving the mouse. All this is way to time wasting. in previous editions a simple right click and moving mouse worked perfectly and would do the same here but this game is not about simplicity. I promise you that.The final straw for me...Today I clicked on a janitor to follow him around for a few seconds...but then couldn't stop following him....no matter what button I clicked or key I pressed I was locked into following the janitor. i had to save and quit the game then relaunch the game to go back and continue playing. This shows that after 3 years of building a game there are still major flaws that just make the game suck! Not to mention that after 3 years I still don't have a full game.....RCT World took the fun out of managing a theme park and instead just gives you something to struggle and get frustrated with. Nothing in this game is simple. Everything is very complex confusing and boring... Sorry RCT i will continue to play previous RCT games but this one is out. You failed majorly.

content:
Posted: May 8, 2016
Early Access Review
								A lot of people have issues with details such as park management, mediocre graphics, horrible staff and peep AI, etc.I fully agree with these, but was able to look past this. For me, making free-form coasters was the absolute dream. I'm a bit of a coaster freak, and I finally had a chance to rebuild my favorite coasters around he world in my parks. I could not have been more hopeful, and after hours and hours of figuring out the finicky coaster building tool, I finally created an exact replica of El Toro at Six Flags. So when it had an intensity rating of 21.7, ultra-extreme, and no peeps would ride it, I was understandably disappointed. My next few attempts produced similar results, though they were all exact replicas or closely based off of many of the prominent coasters in the world today. To put hours into this difficult process only to have the majority of my peeps not ride it and a massive pile of vomit in my exits is, well, not good.Fine, gameplay mechanics be damned, I would do what I could do build an aethetically pleasing park incorporating realistic roller coasters. I put even more hours and hours into this process, only to have both the parks I built crash the game before being able to load. All of my time lost.Update after update promising updated coaster mechanics and improved realism and all we get is this bull. I wish I hadn't played this so much already so I could get my money back. A decade-long disappointment.

number of helpful: 29 of 44 people (66%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								I had high hopes for this game and waited a very long time to experience another rollercoaster tycoon game due to me being a big fan of the origional 3. Once beta of this game came out and all the negative publicity started, I thought for sure the developer would truly start caring about how to fix it and make it all that it could possibly be, especially with fierce competition from planet coaster (which I bought beta access for at the same time as buying RCT world). After playing both I was truly amazed at the level of complexity planet coaster gave it's peeps and the level of detail involved in the game even at such an early stage of developement. I unfortunately was not impressed with RCT world, I wanted to like it soo bad, I wanted to ignore the negative publicity it was getting and keep an open mind and stay positive about how this game could one day be truly amazing, but after the negative beta release which I figured would tighten up their boot straps, The game just doesn't deliver, especially at the cost their asking. I found pathways to be incredibly difficult to place, especially at the entrance of the park where nothing seems to connect, or connect straight for that matter. Also peeps look very bland, If you compare it to PC, its a no brainer, there was no time or thought put into peep movement, intelligence, or even just simple gestures. I found rollercoaster building to be fun and intuitive but when you finally finish the coaster and ride it, it studders and shakes on the track which gets annoying, which was also mentioned in a recent review video. The graphics seem so outdated and bland and when you zoom out the peeps skip frames as they walk and it looks terrible, BTW the graphics were cranked to max and i run dual R9 390x video cards in crossfire. The game may one day be extemely fun to play and easy to use, which i truly hope it is because I will definitely buy it again (I refunded it), but at this stage it is not worth the price tag and it seems the developer has not improved much since beta, so it's difficult to see this game improving from it's early access state, i truly hope I am wrong though. I would not recommend this game at this stage especially with planet coaster right around the corner and looking very promising, so far iv had nothing but fun with that game.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								I've been playing tycoon games, Sim games, pretty much any sandbox sim game I can get my hands on, keep that in mind as I rip into this game. I really wanted to like this game, because the orginal was fantastic, but I can't bring myself to give this game a thumbs up. I won't bother going into too much detail because there are plenty of people who have. The game is plauged with leaks, bugs and glitches and to make things worse the devs. push the blame off on to the player, as if it's our system and not their poor excuse for a tycoon game. It's not just that though, I have a top shelf graphics card and the game looks terrible, when you zoom out you can really tell how much time they DIDN'T take on the game. The "peeps" all have block heads and are emotionless, they move like a robot from the 1950's and noone travels the park in a group. building paths is a pain, getting paths to connect to rides or other paths (which is a huge part of the game) is next to impossible. The scenery looks like junk, flat flowers, no variety, lifeless tress, meaning they don't sway, no leafs blowing, nothing. the lack of detail is littered through out the game, from the peeps to the scenery, even the daylight/nighttime cycles look like they were made on a platform from 98'. I cannot stress how bad this game is, just because it's still in beta dosen't mean " oh there might still be hope" because this game is a disaster, so abandon all hope . This company and it's affilates will most likly take the money they've made off us suckers and walk. The devs are a trip and will give you a to do list in order to give you information that will be of no use, it's almost like they have no clue what they're doing and can't adress anything inparticular so they just flood you with a list of possible soultions to THEIR broken game, which in the end , like I said, will be of no use. Almost like they just have a copy and paste response, which I know what you're thinking" of course" but it's really bad, like toddlers made a game on dad's computer bad. This game has no bussiness even being for sale, making it free to play wouldn't help, the game in one word , SUCKS. I could go on to about the lack of effort, detail, time and money that went into this game but I think you get the point. I regret not reading the reveiws on this one but I suggest you keep reading them, you'll see my story matches up to almost everyone else. Save your money, this isn't the late and great rollercoaster tycoon game you kneww and loved, this is a cheap rip off and if I could I would give it 2 thumbs down.

content:

Early Access Review
								Never will i buy a game from Atari anymore. This is bull****!! People please read...The frames drop even harder than a bowling bawl tossed out of a window!! Not even a steady 30FPS on medium graphics. And that with a i7-3770K 16GB Memmory, 256GB SSD and a AMD Radeon R9 290X graphics card. Then they tried to make the visitors smarter by making their own choices and going directly to the thing they need. So if they are hungry, they would go to a stand for food. If they needed to go to the toilet, they would go to the toilet. Well i think that the one who wrote this system for RCT World was a very very drunk man. The system fails in every way. Even the waiting lines are bugged. People tend to stay halfway the waiting line and dont walk on.Then the coaster building... Luckily they kept some off the old handelings because building with the mouse is not done! And here is the way you build a couster who is actually fun to ride:* Build a coaster* Destroy the coaster * Go on the ferris wheelAnd then, omg are the rides made of plastic? Every ride i build got broken within a few minutes real time. I allmost got up to 30 mechanics for 20 rides and still they got broken and could not be fixxed fast.This is my first time writing a review. Most of the time i think the people will get it if a game is bad or even worse. But such a big name as RCT... What a fail... If you want to spend money on a park building game, go to Planet Coaster. It costs a little more to help the developers ( like € 64,95 ), but than you have a great park building game with great looking graphics and a really good engine.

								Well they pushed the release date back about 4 times before we got the general Q1 2016 release date, which i thought for sure was them trying to hide that they had killed the game in production. I played the game during the first Beta weekend and it looks like they just added in the peep textures, a couple flat rides, and just released it again. I mean fence builder was the biggest complaint from the First public beta and guess what...There is still no sign of it in the game other then on a to-do list on their website somewhere. This is still a beta build, but for how long they have pushed this game back you think there would be more than 10 coaster types or even building for that matter.I think they tried to get the jump on the market by trying to release the game a year early. Even if you ignore how ridiculously bugging it is then its still missing content. Stock RCT3 Had more content at launch then this game does 4 months after it original launch date and multiple betas. Most of these complaints are about the studio behind this game and how poor their development cycle is if this is all they have to show for multiple missed release dates and multiple open closed betas.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								I must admit that, in general, I am disappointed with the game so far. I understand it is still in Early Access and I'll still give it a chance to fix its problems until the full release, but it is definitely not what I was expecting given that I've been playing Roller Coaster Tycoon games ever since the original in the 1990s. Still, I'll try to list my impressions about the game as unbiasedly as humanly possible.I really like the interface. It's simple, it's clean, it's modern and it's elegant. It's refreshing to see a modern take on an interface when, even today, most games still go with tacky and bulky interface designs. Pathing needs a lot of work and I'm finding it really hard to get my paths to be how they I want them to be. It's pretty hard to get nice, snaking queues, for instance. The graphics are okay. Not great, but not horrible. But then again, I think graphics are the least important thing in a game. While in some cases quirky graphics may contribute to ambiance, in most games graphics just don't matter and RCT games are games where it doesn't matter, imo. I actually really like the coaster editor. It's a pretty powerful tool once you get used to it. Staff control is very basic at this point and could use improvement. I'm not the best guy to really assess performance as my computer is already somewhat outdated at this point in time, but I feel it could be better. Considering I can play XCOM 2 with acceptable framerates in a medium graphics setting, I was expecting to run RCTW more smoothly than I do. In particular, loading times seem to be particularly slow on my machine and I've had a few crashes when loading Scenarios.To sum it up, in its current state, RCTW still has a lot of issues. It has good points and bad points and, while I am willing to wait and see if the issues will be fixed in future versions of the game, I can't really recommend it in its current state.

Early Access Review
								I cannot recommend this game in its current state, it's an enjoyable game while it works despite the issues some people have raised about not being able to place paths squarely on the grid etc. As well as bad graphics and some of the more humorous visual bugs I have encountered like one of my park visitors getting stuck underground after riding the slide - I can look past these things.Some of the issues I have encountered however are just completely game breaking, for example; After building my first coaster and testing it, I opened it up for the peeps, they began to queue but nobody was getting on the ride, I tried closing it down and opening it again to see if that helped and while at first it seemed to, once the first load of peeps had finished riding it, they refused to get off. I then tried to edit the coaster to see if i could spot any obvious issues that might be causing this which turned out to be a bad idea because after doing so EVERYBODY in my park started glitching out on the spot and couldn't move.I appreciate that it is an early access game and I will look into posting the bugs I have encountered but really for £29.99 the game should at least be in a playable state.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								As a die hard fan of the RollerCoaster Tycoon series I was extremely excited to try out the latest installment in the series. I avoided the reviews and Lets Plays on youtube purposely so that I could judge the game by its merits alone. That being said, there is unfortunately a lot wrong with the game. The path system is a disaster and half the time it refuses to let me place paths in places that are unobstructed. The peeps are completely lifeless while they are on rides and you can watch them cycle through various terrifying facial expressions while remaining dead silent the entire time. (Its honestly only a bad soundtrack away from being a horror movie.) Perhaps this is just a glitch on my end, but half the time buildings and rides don't actually show you whether or not they are closed which led me to accidentally forget to open half the stuff in my park. (Oops!) I also noticed that the days seemed... Shorter? Like, almost ridiculously short. I feel like they could be slightly longer. In order to see my park at night I have to lock the time set to night time or else you'd miss it if you looked away for two seconds. There are so many little things that could be fine tuned, that would make this such a great game. I want to like this game so bad because a huge chunk of my childhood was spent playing both RCT2 and RCT3. RCTW is just not holding up compared to even RCT3. I'm hoping the developers really are serious about improving the game because it has so much potential. Until then, I cannot recommend it.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is far from finished. It's so far from finished that I can't believe they're saying it's full featured enough and they're just releasing the base game so they can add more features later on. No, the serious problem here is that the base features that are available right now just plainly don't work, and even some simple things just don't exist (you have zero control over staff, for example). I can see the potential here, but so much stuff is just so broken. The real redeeming quality of this game is the coaster builder, but just about everything else doesn't seem to work. I'm so glad the devs decided to dump this into Early Access, because otherwise I would've felt so betrayed. I still feeled betrayed though, by the high price for such an unfinished game. I really hope the developers get their act together. I could barely even start my park because I spent like 30 minutes trying to understand the convuluted and idiotic path building system, and my paths still look awful. Even the wonderful coaster editor needs some polishing, it doesn't really give me enough realtime information and my coasters kept flying off the track.Here's my first look at the game:  


YouTube™ Video: Rollercoaster Tycoon World | Ep. 1 | Rings Of Disappoint | Early Access Gameplay 

			Views: 247		

			A first look at Rollercoaster Tycoon World, a somewhat disappointing, yet fun sequel to the fan favorite Rollercoaster Tycoon series.		

 Clearly I wasn't in the correct mindset to be playing a buggy game (yeah let's play what is essentially an alpha right after major surgery), but at the same time this game is barely even ready for Early Access. I continued that first look with a video dedicated to the wonderful coaster editor here: 


YouTube™ Video: Rollercoaster Tycoon World | Ep. 2 | The Unexciting Puke Machine | Early Access Gameplay 

			Views: 146		

			My mouth was still full of gauze for this, but here's what happens when you just try to build a rollercoaster in RCTW. The builder is impressive, the execution...well you can see how that went.		

 . It still needs work, unfortunately, I was really hoping that it was going to work out of the gate. It IS fun though, but you generally end up making puke machines that rate low on the in-game excitement scale. Would I recommend this game to friends? Not right now. Would I maybe recommend this game to friends in the future? Probably, as I feel like there's a lot of potential for this to be a modern version of the first three RCT games. Will this game ever be worth $50-60? No, probably not. You guys are reeaaaally pushing it with that price point, I would probably pay max $30-40 for this, even if it were full-featured and polished.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								The RCT series has been one of my favorite simulation game series for a long time. I was ecstatic when I heard this game was coming out and preordered it....a year ago. Now fast forward a bit after the two messy beta weekends where the game was nowhere near completion. Then when the game was delayed from December (I think), I sent out a refund request to Atari so that I could get my money back for the many disappointments and they started to work with me. After giving them my receipt information like they requested...I didn't hear back for weeks, I sent in another request to get my money back and nothing. I figure it's because they knew the game would be releasing soon...and a few days later, they released that it would come out on March 31st. So, whatever, I am abandon my refund request cause what the hell. And then I play this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥ I know its still early access but come on everyone. This game barely runs and I have a nice enough rig to play Fallout 4, GTA V, Borderlans Pre Sequel, and Skyrim all out high to intense graphic settings with no problem. This? The FPS drops to around 15-20 when more than 2 rides are placed, or I'm building something, or a significant amount of peeps enter the park. This is early access, but this is not okay. This game should be able to do the basic things, and it just doesn't deliver. I will review this game again once it gets out of early access, but for now I am done wasting my time on this.

number of helpful: 14 of 19 people (74%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm glad I got this game for free from a friend who got two keys bundled in some hardware or software or something, I don't remember. He, however, remembered that I've always been a huge RCT3 fan since 2005 and I still play that game to this day. It's just a colorful pleasure every time.THIS game... well... let's first get the most important thing out of the way:DO NOT BUY THIS GAME for the current asking price of 46 Euros!!I understand that many want to support these developer but... seriously... if they DARE to throw this game on Steam in THIS state, they don't seem to care about it all that much anyway. I for one don't expect them to really put any true passion in this product anymore. I do realize that they've called it "Early Access" now, but that's only because they've realized (by having that beta event) that their customers can't be deceived that easily and immediately called them out on HOW unfinished the game really is. This game should get MANY more months of thorough development and quality assurance and could then be released. Everything else is just BS, if you ask me.Remeber the feeling of playing the old RCT trilogy? How much fun it was to enjoy many hours in that colorful, sunlit atmosphere, just watching the park visitors laugh, kiss, play and have fun? How well-rounded it all felt? The friendly and yet functional interface, the music, the whole look and feel?That's all gone now.The people in this game look like hideous soulless creatures. The last time I saw such an atrocious design of humans was in Egosoft's "X Rebirth" (remember those grandmas?). They're just uncomfortable to look at. (So that's why they never showed the peeps' faces in their official trailer/making of videos...)The interface looks like a gray, neutral, managerial iPod-like interface. COMPLETELY devoid of color. Just gray with white lines. Yeah, that just screams "fun", doesn't it?The terrain in this game manages to instantly disappoint. Really. Disappointment at first sight. And even when you've started building and embellishing your park... it STILL looks cold and bare. Hard edges everywhere and with a strangely gloomy lighting.In the previous games you looked at the empty terrain and the colorful interface and you wanted to dive in!In THIS game, you instead feel an urge to quickly build *SOMETHING* in order to fend off the depressing atmosphere.There are countless comfortable options that are left out. Filtering your available structures by theme, to just name one.I just feel sorry for Nvizzio.Atari has become a disgusting publisher, really, which became painfully evident by their recent trainwrecks "Alone in the Dark: Illumination", "Asteroids: Outpost", "Haunted House: Cryptic Graves" and the ridiculous mobile cashgrab freemium "game" titled "Rollercoaster Tycoon 4 Mobile". Recycling titles of popular (sometimes iconic) franchises and churning out utter garbage.Seriously... until "Planet Coaster" by Frontier Developments (the original creators of the RCT series) is out, just stick to RCT3 Deluxe. "Rollercoaster Tycoon World" just isn't worth your time so far. It might be when it's finished, but it's FAR from finished at this point.

Early Access Review
								It's not that the game is frustrating, it's just boring. I had no joy playing it. I was tempted to say bureaucrats created this game, yet it's a really bad management game.Coasters, in RCTW, makes less revenue then the Bull ride!Coasters don't justify the investment, yet they're the whole point of the game...You have no control and therefore no idea which part of the park is covered by the staff.You need an Info boot every 2 rides, if not peeps get lost...You cannot set a range of prices for shops.Only food shops make revenue, gift shops are usuless... content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								To begin with, I didn't read the reviews first so my point of view wasn't tainted right off the bat. Honestly though this game doesn't live up to the franchise. The graphics are better than RTC3, but not 8 years better. The motion of the rides and peeps is not smooth. The graphics appear more cartoonish, less realistic. The game frequently hangs up or freezes and it loads very slow. Not nearly as many options as previous versions (ie no transit rides). The curved pathways are neat, but nothing lines up properly when using those tools (hedges and fences don't follow curves). Hedge and fence pieces are all one length, which leaves gaps. Limited tree options and no bushes. Peep movements are not natural, nor is their vomiting habits and urinating on the pathways (seriously?) I could go on and on. I want to like it, because I loved RTC 2 and 3, but it just is not there. I realize this is early access and I think the devs can fix many of the problems, but I don't see them going back and redesigning all of the graphics to the level you might expect them to be for a game created in 2015-2016. They really have a lot of work to do, and as loyal as I am to the franchise I don't see them pulling it off properly. I hope I'm wrong because I messed with it for an hour longer than the refund policy allows...

number of helpful: 191 of 350 people (55%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												This game is really pretty, but I honestly can't recommend it. And yes, I realize that it's an early beta for the roller coaster builder. But the roller coaster builder (the core of the game) is absolutely broken. I wanted so badly to like it.While the spline editor is a great idea, it just doesn't work in any feasible way. You'll pull out your hair trying to refine anything, and forget about making straight track. The result is an ugly, unrealistic, gangly, and awkward roller coaster that takes up way too much space and barely runs. There's no precision and the controls are so touchy that you'll find yourself screaming at your computer. Skill aside, it shouldn't take over an hour to lay down a lift hill--only to have the train randomly crash on a simple and shallow (forced by the game) pre-lift drop.Please delay the full release of this game. Go back to the drawing board. Try compromising the spline editor with the piece-by-piece system to allow for the compact and interesting coasters the franchise is known for while keeping the smoother rides.

content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
Early Access Review
								Alright after reading through some reviews that were negative and searching for the positive ones to no real good avail I have decided to write my review. YES this game has the Roller Coaster Tycoon title but does it really feel like the RCT we know and love? Not really to be completely honest. I was so excited for this game to release and my s/o was generous enough to buy it for me when it was available for purchase so I didnt really spend my OWN money on it. But I do feel for those who did pay for it themselves with their OWN money. I have enjoyed the game so far to a point but I have run into a few issues and these are kind of major ones.Coaster Customizations:This is a big one for me! I absolutely love building and designing my own coasters and I figured this point to point style system of building would lead to some REALLY cool coasters. And although it is a very useful thing its a bit confusing at first to use. But what I was really disappointed in is that there is a lack of pre-set parts for the coasters such as loops, corkscrews and twists. Yes they have some but then when you do use them they seem to have messed with the coaster a bit and changes the way it works entirely. Another complaint with the coaster builder that has REALLY frusterated me is how the BRAKES SYSTEM doesnt seem to WORK PROPERLY (at least for me) now it may be something that I am doing wrong but I get to a point where I want to have the "Block Breaks" so I can add a stop point for a second coaster to pause at while the other coaster is at the station. Ive done it in 2 and 3 plenty of times. But when I test the coaster it seems to give me the error that the "Coaster did not complete its circut" and then the second caoster never takes off? This is really weird to me and would like a bit of an easier block break system.The final thing with the coasters and really the rides overall is that you cant really customize them too much. Like for example; you can change the colors of the tracks but you cant really fully customize the train cars, you have preset trains available. But I would like to see the ability to add patterns and change individual colors on the trians. Maybe instead of the individual color boxes you can choose, try implementing a COLOR WHEEL with ALL the RGB colors on them?Scenery options are a bit of a disappointment not much able to mess with there.ALSO THE BIGGEST ISSUE I AM HAVING IS A HUGE ISSUE WITH MY MEMORY RUNNING LOW WHILE PLAYING THE GAME FOR MORE THAN AN HOUR!!I have 8GB of Corsair Vengance RAM DDR3 1600MHz and IDK WHY I am getting the error that my computer is running out of memory....Thats really all the issues I have with this game. I like it when it works, but it needs some fixing. I would recommend the game but not at this current time.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
Early Access Review
								Review for RCTW Beta Weekend One (10/30/15)The newest Rollercoaster Tycoon game in the series!-Please note before reading, remember that the purpose of this beta was, "to test out the key features of the coaster builder and associated systems" (RCTW Blog #22) -This beta is not going to represent what the entire final product is going to be, it will change overtime with feedback from us, the community, until RCTW Beta Weekend Two rolls around! Please read the entire review to know why I don't reccomend this at this current moment.-General OverviewLikes:- Path customization- Good variety of pathways and scenery in general for beta.- Water physics- Terrain Deformation tools- Good looking UI- Guests were spooky ghosts only for a limited time since it Halloween is approaching as I am typing this.Dislikes:- Crashing!- Takes ages to recover from a crash.- No options to change settings such as audio, graphics, etc in the beta.- No snapping to objects like fences to make placement faster- No grid!- Can't remove added trains when customizing coaster.- Framerate is all over the place.- No tutorial!Noticed Bugs:- When doing something else on your PC while RCTW is loading, the game tends to crash. (e.g. opening steam overlay, leaving window.)- Once placing station and forced to edit the coaster, when accidently exiting before placing a track and going back to edit wont allow you to place any track and gives you an "Invalid Location!" error.- Tons of black little dots appear on the main menu sometimes.Summary     Honestly, I felt kind of dissapointed with the beta. But don't get me wrong, this game has major potential to be something big and unique but at the current stance of the beta, I'm kind of iffy on what was only given to us to provide feedback. But anyways, the beta included great elements in the coaster builder which included a lot more coaster customization when laying out the tracks. It didn't feel like it was only a set of pre-modeled tracks and looked like it gave peeps whiplash when making tilted turns (like in rct3) and allowed me to make smooth, curvy tracks. The only thing that gave me a problem in the coaster builder is that there was no way to remove added carts! This is a major key feature in the coaster builder! But if there was a way to remove carts, feel free to correct me.     The pathway design improved a lot since the previous RCT game. Now there is the ability to make curved paths which is fantastic, and also realistic! There was also a variety of pathways to choose from and also had different sizes which allowed a lot more customization to the game. Not only there was a variety of pathways, but also a variety of scenery to decorate your park. This included many lampposts, benches, trees, etc to use! And to even add onto that, the Terrain Deformation Tool allows you to customize your park with pretty, vibrant hills with also the use of the terrain sprayer. It also included a water tool to make lakes or ponds.     Now don't think the beta was all fine and dandy! There was also many things that I was dissapointed about which was the lack of a tutorial, which pretty much there to show you how to play. It was pretty much get into the game and figure out what to do. Although it did not take long, I eventually figured out some of the controls. And one thing that bugged me the most was the placement of pathways, stations, and scenery since there was no grid to make things neat. It also helps alot when creating straight pathways. Also the game pretty much crashed a lot in the loading screens, framerate was all over the place, and there was no options to customize your game. Hopefully this will get added soon for the second beta!But yeah, to conclude this review, I do not reccomend this game yet because it can go either way. It could go terrific or can go bad. If you are really considering, I reccomend it if you are a fan of the RCT series like me, and support the developers of the game and provide tons of feedback for them to read!

content:
Posted: November 12, 2016
Early Access Review
								I have been a dedicated player of Roller Coaster Tycoon since it first came out and that is why I thought that Roller Coaster Tycoon World would be such a great game.  After over 200 hours of working on a park and trying out the various features of the game I found I did not like it as much as the previous version.  The game is too glitchy, for example the new path system that is supposed to allow you to have customized paths will not allow you to make some connections with other paths.  The new piece by piece building feature is a nice touch, but if you decide to rotate the building, or move it, any shops you have built inside will get thrown out of alignment.  I was very excited today to learn that the game will be fully released on 11/16, the article had mentioned it's releawse date is a day before Planet Coaster.  Being curious I decided to try out Planet Coaster and I am now regretting the money I spent on Roller Coaster Tycoon.  Planet Coaster has incredible graphics, the rides are incredibly easy to design and build, and their path system truly does allow you to design and connect the paths the way you want.  I got more enjoyment out of 2 hours of messing around with Planet Coaster than I did with 200+ hours of Roller Coaster Tycoon World.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												This is more of a "thumbs in the middle, leaning up" recommendation. I, like most other people reviewing the beta, grew up with the first two games, and still play them to this day. Pros:+Terrain editing and manipulation is FANTASTIC. Very easy to use and navigate, much more so than any of the previous games. Creating valleys, hills, mountains, holes, etc. is super easy and intuitive, and the water tool is much simpler than in previous games. +Pathing is also a huge improvement in RCTW. You can change the size of paths, as well as create curved paths. Much easier and less tedious to lay down as well. +Game itself is very pretty to look at. +Camera works like RCT3, a positive in my eyes. +I don't hate the coaster editor like some other reviews have stated. To be fair, I rarely messed around with it in the previous games. I'm not creative or talented enough to create anything worthy of laying down in a park, so I always relied on pre-built designs and online downloads for my coaster needs. That said, I found it simple enough to use after getting through a relatively steep learning curve. My biggest complaint with it is that the mouse sensitivity is too high, but I'm assuming (hoping) that we will have the option to tone it down upon release. Cons:-Physics seem way, way off. Coasters seem much too slow, and coaster stats appear to be questionable at best. -Time passes, way, way too fast. An in-game day goes by in what seems like 15 seconds, even on the slowest setting. -Everything seems too "big". This is a difficult one to explain. -This seems like a game that is six months to a year from release, not one a month and a half away. Menus are basic and ugly to look at, there are very, very few decoration items (assuming that there will be mcuh more at release), and descriptive text in menus is completely missing, or occupied by generic placeholder text.

Early Access Review
								It really bums me out to write this review.Let me start by telling you the blame for this fiasco is squarely on Atari. They hired a studio that had no reputation to build the game originally. They wasted a lot of time and money and didn't have anything to show for it.Since Atari brought Nvizzio on to finish the game, huge improvements were made in short amount of time. I have a lot of respect for the hard work Nvizzio is doing.Still, Atari set horrible expectation during the whole process and they've not done a great job of communicating with people following the progress of this game. I'm fairly against pre-ordering games, but after the progress I saw Nvizzio making I decided to pre-order to show my support. They didn't deliver on any of the pre-order perks and went silent again for months. Until today.Now the game is releasing in Early Access, which I'm typically a fan of, but I didn't pre-order an unfinished game. Obviously being Early Access the performance is pretty horrible, even on high end hardware. So yeah, don't buy this game. Not yet. I think it will be great in a year or two, but right now it's just a mess and Atari doesn't deserve your money for how they've treated this game.

number of helpful: 36 of 62 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is not a bad game, but it has serious limitations which are a) infuriating and b) extraordinary considering this is about the fifth version of the game.My kids love the sandbox version, which allows them an unlimited budget to put together the teme park of their dreams and ride on the attractions they've created.  Frankly, $30 is quite a lot to pay for a kid's game.The campaign game, whereby grown-ups attempt to achieve goals, seems buggy.  The first time I played it, it gave me the option to build a handful of rides, but no paths.  Even as the game was telling me that I needed to build paths so park visitors could reach the rides that I'd built, it was giving me no option to build a path.The second time I played it, it gave me a paths option after a few minutes, and then a buildings option.  Then, after I'd built a few buildings, it took the buildings option away, and refused to restore it, even after I'd expanded the park substantially.  The game was telling me that my visitors were hungry, but denied me any opportunity to build restaurants.  The game told me rides were breaking down, but denied me any opportunity to build mechanic stations to provide the machenics to fix the rides.  Eventually, my park simply ground to a halt.At no time did the campaign game provide me an opportunity to build a flower bed.  I see lots of screenshots above of luscious parks, with lamps, and decorations, and attractions, but my experience is that you can only create such scenes in the sandbox version in which everything is unlocked.  Althogh I played the campaign games to the point that I had fairly extensive parks, never could I have constructed the screenshots in the publicity.Paths are the single, most-infuriating thing in the game.  In real life, you can build a path anywhere.  In Switzerland, they buld entire freeways across the Alps and through some of the world's largest mountains.  So why is constructing a dirt path across your theme park a great world of "You can't do that"?  You need to make very certain in advance of where your paths are going to go, and you can't add to many extensions to them without extensive demolitionand reconstruction.  Visitors on the path constitute obstructions, so if you're hoping to rebuild a major pathway, you have little option but to close the park and wait for the traffic to clear.  This will take a very long time and represent a potentially catastrophic loss of income, but it's the only way you can reconstruct a path!  Other problems with path construction are too numerous to detail here.  Suffice to say that probably noting in this game will raise your blood pressure  more than path construction.All this said, the sandbox version is a lot of fun, in a SimCity kind of way.  If all you want to do is construct the theme park of your dreams, and then ride on all your attractions, it's great.  But I find it extraordinary that the developers have allowed the program's very obvious weaknesses to go ahead -- or even that the program's weaknesses weren't taken with in previous versions.  By the fourth version, you really shouldn't have to be enduring the frustration of non-functioning software! Actually, you shouldn't have to endure it in the first version.It has the potential to be a really brilliant game.  Were it not for the bugs, it would be.  But it seems to have been released on a premise of, "It'll do."  The assumption seems to be that, if the graphics are brilliant (and they are superlative!), the public will forgive you if they don't actually work.  Well, I'm not a programmer.  I don't play a game for the joy of exclaiming, "Egad!  What good-quality graphics!"  When I pay $30 for a game, I expect it to have been thoroughly tested and to work perfectly.  And this game is anything but that.

content:

Early Access Review
								At the moment I have to give this game a no for recommendation sadly. I had hoped that it would be a great game! But sadly it is missing SO MUCH and it is no where close to properly optimized. This is the first game on my just built PC that actually lags when I am building stuff.So to not just complain, here is a list for the dev's on what they may be able to do to somehwat salvage the game.1). Optimize your♥♥♥♥♥♥ I mean really optimize this game because holy crap.2). There needs to be more variety for rides and buildings, this game is over 10 years old and the original roller coaster tycoons have more rides.... you need to be surpassing that. Things like swimming stuff should already be in the game and not something that would be DLC because they where already in Roller Coaster Tycoon 3.3). Back to touch on something of optimization. You can't make a single path straight and that is starting to♥♥♥♥♥♥me off, nor can you place objects on paths basically wherever you want. This should not be an issue yet it is, I don't see how it can be an issue but you guys seem to have made it an issue.4). Fix the terrain tools so the brushes are larger when you are closer so that you can actually see if you have gotten everything down to the level you want it or up to the level you want it. I am constantly having the problem where I think I got it all then I build something and notice I didn't.5). Optimize the peeps, both workers and guests, so they stop being so dumb about things. I basically have to have a janitor/mechanic for every ride I put in the park because they seem to not move quick enough between everything. As for the peeps, every thrill ride and coaster I constantly have a path covered in puke even if I put a bathroom right next to the exit...6). I think that you guys may be heading in the right direction but there is just simply not enough in the game at the moment to get my recommendation. This may sound harsh, and it is, but I wouldn't even want to release the game with how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ it is at the moment. Add things like research and development into the game to unlock things, don't gate them behind completing parts of the campaign. That is tidious and annoying when I have no real control over what I want more of.7). Developers, listen to your audience and realize♥♥♥♥♥♥is going wrong at the moment. For example the grid, well since the grid isn't properly alligned at the moment it doesnt work, simple and easy fix but yet you guys haven't done it. Just please listen to your audience so that you stop getting such negative reviews.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								You could try and ignore all the many bugs, the rubbish graphics, the really awful looking guests, the amateurish animations, the bad AI, the cheap and often incorrect sounds, the slow map loading, the low framerates, and the blury out of focus camera to stop you noticing the lack of details in the models and textures, if you really want to play this game, but you're better off rolling round in a stinging nettle bush.I realise that currently this is an early release game. however, this must have been done on a low budget and it is not worthy of being part of the Rollercoaster Tycoon series.  Many of the current issues were reported to the developers by testers months ago (why are they not fixed?).If you want to play a top quality triple A Rollercoaster game then look at Frontier's Planet Coaster, the developers of Rollercoaster Tycoon 3.  Although, at the time of writing this review Planet Coaster is currenly in early alpha, it is vastly better than this disaster.Honestly, save yourself money and anguish and avoid this game (and stinging nettle).

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												I'm gonna recommend this game for the following reasons:  - The game is in beta stage, and they've made beta testing mainly to fix bugs, and find main issues on the way. However after i've seen this beta so far, there's still alot they'll need to improve, but the tools you do have are excellent compared to other coasters. - It's like Cities Skylines of Roller Coaster games, mainly because the community is huge for this game, and steam workshop. A lot of people fear that there's only 10 coasters, don't worry just wait 1-3 months and you'll have pretty much every coaster in the world to play around with. Not only can you share what you've made, but also most likely see legendary coasters in-game. But for every coaster i guess they'll look on highway systems from Cities Skylines for an example where you could pick different interchanges from the community, in this game under speciality, you'll most likely find extreme versions of loops, corkscrews and etc. - Even though the game is pretty good so far, as i said earlier there's a lot of features they'll need to add. It's almost impossible to make something 100% straight, and i will go cry in a corner if they don't add such a feature, because that's mainly one of the few things you'll need. So after this review, i would say the game got a bright future, but it takes some time to get used to, i really wanted a tutorial in the beta, just to know how the mechanics work. It's nice to being able to tweak EVERYthing on your coaster. But they should add classic mode coaster building from the older games. All in all if it was up to me i would give it 7/10 for now, but it's only in beta and hopefully it will only improve from full release 10th dec. But lets see how the next beta goes, and if the game actually improved or they'll need to push the release date a few months.

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								I am a huge fan of RCT3 and I was dreaming of the release of a sequel since a couple of years after its release in 2004. Up until yesterday before the release, I was only slightly frustrated it was taking so much time for the game to come out (it was originally planned to be released early 2015) as I really wanted the game to be as great as possible and did not mind Atari taking time to make a game that would deserve to be called RCT, especially after I got to play the beta back in November 2015 when I saw that they were very far from having any part of the game finished at all.But after such a long wait when I finally got to play RCTW yesterday, I went through extreme excitement to denial, followed by disgust and finally ended up laughing nervously in front of my screen.To make it simple, if RCT3, a 12 years old game was released today, it would still be by very, very, very far a better game.In RCTW, everything is broken:- The graphics of the peeps, structures and the land when zoomed are absolutely disgusting and can compete with games like Super Mario 64 released 20 years ago (I am barely exaggerating)- The roller coaster building system is completely broken and it takes hours to complete one that has many chances to end up not working properly at the end.- It is very buggy, I mean so so so so so buggy, I had to relaunch the game 3 times in 2 hours I never saw anything like that before.- Despite the fact that they look like they were made using MS Paint, the peeps will look like either vampires (Vendors at stands with red eyes) or zombies (they walk like zombies when they hold anything), or witches (janitors cleaning vomit with a broom and hovering when moving). Looks like they got the horror theme right at least!- The non roller coasters rides are not only very few but look worse than the ones on RCT3. The way peeps act while on some of them is completely unnatural and it just hurts so much looking at it.- Unless I missed something, there is only ONE song that can be played for all the rides. They give you the option to change it depending on the theme but essentially, it is the same song just slightly different! And if you have 2 rides next to each other and play the music on both, the music is not synchronised and I let you imagine what it sounds like!- Even when I got frustrated and tried to be nasty with my peeps this would not work! The peep picking tool does not work, taking one and putting them at the opposite part of the park teleports them back to their original place after a few seconds, peeps in cars that are ejected from the coaster will be teleported to the exit, and drowning peeps (Yes, I was very annoyed at this point!) by adding water does not work, they either keep walking underwater or may eventually stop moving and start "jumping" in the water indefinitely.A few extras:-Most park management options from RCT3 are gone.-Peeps disappearing, flying, going through walls, queuing the wrong way.-Female peeps (even male?) make porn sounds.-Sounds of babies crying all the time or children sounding like they are being tortured.-Background decors unfinished.I am stopping here but I could add more, and that is after having played the game only 2 hours!But I know what some of you may want to say: "it's normal it's an early access!"Well, before you go any further, here is a thing: Atari had planned to release the game early 2015, and after being postponed multiple times, we got to play the beta in November 2015. More than 4 months later, I cannot see ANY improvement whatsoever that has been made. (I actually think it is even worse as during the beta we did not get the chance to see the monstrosity that are the peeps as they were only "ghosts" back then.)Atari had multiple chances and a lot of time to improve the game but fact is they just did not care so I cannot see how this game will be any better in the future. I requested a refund of the game and advise everyone not to buy this game.A very disappointed fan.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2016
Early Access Review
								We are huge fans of RollerCoaster Tycoon, however, we are done with this franchise and want a refund.  RollerCoaster Tycoon World  is a FAIL on so many levels---a few examples are: there is no edge scrolling so you need two hands to play the game; the graphics look like cartoon graphics, not what was presented in the trailer; the game  play space to too small for the sizes of the pre-made rides, too many trees that need to be deleted because the rollercoaster takes up more than half of the park space (that is filled with trees!) ---the list goes on!  We suggest that you go back to the drawing board using RollerCoaster Tycoon 1 (Deluxe) as the base game and improve the graphices on that one ---even that would be better that what you have provided.   If you are planning to be new to the franchise don't waste your money on this one; buy the first two if you want to have clean and simple fun and the third one if you prefer a more graphic experience,  This one is not worth the money.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								At this point in time, RollerCoaster Tycoon World just isn't ready. To be honest, for a game that was to be complete by this point in time, only to be shunned into Early Access again, and to be as buggy as can be - I don't think this merits spending the $20 that I did (I bought this game through a CD key on a different website, so I cannot refund the game, but hey, it was $20). If you are planning on spending $50 on the game at this time, please don't. It's not worth it. $20 is pushing it at the time - I know there is the opportinuty for this game to get better, and if it does, I will go back and I will change my review.On a more positive note, the game is very stable - I don't think it is quite as efficient as it could be, but again, that is an expectation for an Early Access game. I think to be fair, that is something that will get better over time. I had no issues with the game crashing or anything like that - it was laggy until I adjusted graphics settings, but overall it was fine. There are a ton of graphical bugs in this game though - Roller coasters suddenly having peeps go away for no reason, that kind of thing.Overall, I'd stay away for now. Give it some more time. I think there is a chance it will get better.... but I can't say for sure.

number of helpful: 9 of 12 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
Early Access Review
								You know to be completely honest I loved RCT all the way up to RCT3 Platinum. But honestly now I feel its gone into the wrong hands. I really think I know where it went wrong, Atari. The game was originally created by one man, then in 2 Frontier came in to make it even better, In 3 it was still great when Atari came in, but when Atari seized power all was lost. Atari made some good games, unfortunately Rollercoaster sims are not their thing. I don't want Atari to feel horrible or like it is a lost cause, because quite frankly some people are still going to enjoy it and some have already bought it, but this project is going to lose them money. I played through a friend, and thought it was fun, but when I saw gameplay for PlanetCoaster my experience was over taken just watching the video. Here is the fact Frontier knows what they are doing, they are making PlanetCoaster, and they therefore changed the name of the true RCT. I think in all fairness your money is better spent there. If you aren't a mechanics freak like me and most others though you'll still enjoy RCT. I am not reccomending the game however, because it hasn't met my criteria. Sorry to the Atari RCTW team, hope you can find better luck in a different and hopefully following project (If this one doesn't send you spiraling out of business).

number of helpful: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm honestly trying very hard to like this game, but the developers have seemingly made it impossible.  I know this is still a game in development.   Where do I start with the issues with this game?  First of all, making a simple path in Rollercoaster Tycoon should never have been made so freaking complicated.  Paths do not connect to other paths correctly and you never can seem to angle the pathways where you want them.  And God forbid you mess up a pathway and need to delete something because, in my experience, you will need to delete almost all your pathways to correct the issue.  What is the point of an elevated pathway if you cannot light it for your peeps?  Rides are hit and miss.  The flatrides sort of come off as generic.  It would be better if you could modify the colors of the flatrides to at least make them appear different instead of the generic colors they come with.  Rollercoasters are seemingly impossible to get working correctly and seem to have an extreme rating even for the most simple of speeds/drops.  So far, every time they do a major patch my parks that I have saved do not want to load.  So I have resignated myself to not get too attached to any park that I create.  I've had two parks so far that I can not use because of updates corrupting the file.  Like I said, I'm trying very hard to like this game but it needs a lot of work.

								Welcome to a game that looks worse then Rollercoaster tycoon 3.I normally never ask for a refund for a game, but holy cow this game is a mess that seems more like coming out of a scam indie studio then a well-known Atari backed studio that seemed to have control on the development and was finally giving us another great rollercoaster tycoon game, but even in early access this game is so broken that it would require a major overhaul so big that we would not see it for a long time and they do not seem willing to do that. content:

								I was about to seek a refund and realized the download was available. I will not compare this game to any other like game currently on the market "for fairness", with that said.. This game was something like a job I got as a teenager, it looks so much better on paper than it did in real life. Somehow it just doesn't seem as fun as all the prior installations and I have played RCT 1-3 (and all the add-ons loopy landscapes, corkscrew follies et al), today there is a sort of vibe, nay, passion missing in RCT. Pro's:My PC didn't crashThings are a hint more attractiveThere is more detail (like a mop bucket behind the janitors station for example) ooohPeeps have no character, groups etc.. The parking lot adds realismI like the park and rides management systemCute ride and shop namesCurved paths nice path detailsLots of plants optionsBenches and lighting can be off the pathsCons:I spent the moneyMore puke than ever - "look a lamp-post" - bleeeghDon't know why the game just seems flat - lifeless. Nothing really snapped to a grid as I expectedI put in nice dining I had zero popularity though I had 600 peeps visit it they must be just reading the menu'sPaths are a pain - periodDecor construction tools was limited - walls etc..Deleting: ever tiny bunch of green and tiny little pebble to put in a ride was just silly.Deleting: select a ride and it's so easy to select another ride nearbyIf there is enough negative feedback - this might be all we get folks.My guess is they had to rush this out to avoid refunds (tough to account for behind the scenes). Seems like someone is spread too thin to have made this right the first time (I feel bad them and wish them luck). This game could have been very profitable if the right internal resources were dedicated to it. If the game is ever finished I'll give it another go but have no plans on participating in early access forums. If this game were $15.99 and I'd give it a thumbs up for value. I think this game is simply OK, I give them a thumbs to the marketing team for getting good revenue. That is one approach to business..

content:
